subsection_name: benh-chlamydia.json_8_Questions related to Chlamydia fungal infection
subsection_content:
1. How long is the incubation period for Chlamydia?
7 – 21 days. The incubation period of Chlamydia is calculated from the time the patient is exposed to the chlamydia trachomatis bacteria, until the symptoms appear clearly.
2. Does chlamydia go away on its own?
Are not! Chlamydia does not go away on its own. If not detected and treated early, the disease can seriously harm your health. At the same time, spreading Chlamydia to others puts them at risk of serious complications.
3. Is it okay if chlamydia is left untreated?
Have! Untreated chlamydia can be dangerous to your health. The disease causes many serious complications such as pelvic inflammation, prostate infection, ectopic pregnancy, and even infertility in men and women...
4. How long does it take to cure chlamydia?
1 or 2 weeks! Chlamydia will go away within 1 or 2 weeks. However, the disease can still return. Therefore, absolutely do not have sex during treatment to avoid reinfection.
Specialized in Dermatology - Skin Aesthetics, Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, has high-end, specialized treatment services. With modern equipment, and a team of experienced doctors and medical staff, Tam Anh General Hospital always brings dedicated, quality, and effective health care services to patients.
Useful information from the above article will help understand more about Chlamydia disease, causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention measures. Therefore, as soon as there are signs of suspected disease, you should quickly see a specialist for advice and a treatment regimen to limit dangerous complications.
